request.description:
This service creates a new alert. There are 3 different alert levels - campaign, advertiser and client. 

NOTE: You need to specify campaign level on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: v1/alerts/campaign/00000/alerts
(00000 - CampaignId)

Tips on request body:
- Type is always a number
- Settings depend on type
- CampaignManager/campaignCoManager value "true" enables CampaignManager or CampaignCoManager to receive alers.

This method returns list of own and inherited alerts for specified campaign.

You can filter alerts by parsing AlertID in your request URL. 

EXAMPLE: v1/alerts/campaign/00000/alerts/11111
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - AlertID)

This service updates alert details or its status (using property "isEnabled").

NOTE: You need to define AlertId on request URL.

EXAMPLE: v1/alerts/campaign/00000/alerts/11111"
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - AlertId).

NOTE: You can retrieve AlertId using "Get Alerts" method.

This method deletes a specified alert.

NOTE: You need to define AlertId on request URL.

EXAMPLE: v1/alerts/campaign/00000/alerts/11111"
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - AlertId).

NOTE: You can retrieve AlertId using "Get Alerts" method.

This method returns a list of campaign attributes, filtered by specified CampaignId. 

CampaignId is required in your request url. 

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes
(00000 - CampaignId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

NOTE: You can filter campaign attributes by parsing CampaignAttributeId.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes/11111
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - CampaignAttributesId)

This method returns a list of values from a certain campaign attribute.

CampaignId and CampaignAttributeIdis required in your request url. 

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes/11111/Values
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - CampaignAttributesId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

You can retrieve CampaignAttributesId using "GET Campaign Attributes" method.

NOTE: You can filter campaign attribute values by parsing CampaignAttributeValueId.

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes/11111/Values/22222
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - CampaignAttributesId, 22222 - ValueId)

This method creates a new campaign attribute, which later can be assigned to each banner in order to batch them and sort the reports data out according to the attribute values.

CampaignId is required in your request url. 

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes
(00000 - CampaignId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

This method removes an existing campaign attribute.

CampaignId and Campaign Attribute Id is required in your request url. 

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes/11111
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - CampaignAttributeId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

You can retrieve CampaignAttributeId using "Get Campaign Attributes" method.

This method adds a new value for a campaign attribute.

CampaignId and CampaignAttributeId is required in your request url. 

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes/11111/Values
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - CampaignAttributeId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

You can retrieve CampaignAttributeId using "GET Campaign Attributes" method.

This method renames existing campaign attribute.

CampaignId and CampaignAttributeId is required in your request url. 

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes/11111/Title
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - CampaignAttributesId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

You can retrieve CampaignAttributeId using "GET Campaign Attributes" method.

This method deletes a value from campaign attribute.

CampaignId, CampaignAttributeId and ValueId is required in your request url. 

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes/11111/Values/22222
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - CampaignAttributeId, 22222 - ValueId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

You can retrieve CampaignAttributeId using "GET Campaign Attributes" method.

This method renames an existing value on selected campaign attribute.

CampaignId, CampaignAttributeId and ValueId is required in your request url. 

EXAMPLE: /api/v1/CampaignSettings/00000/CampaignAttributes/11111/Values/22222
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - CampaignAttributeId, 22222 - ValueId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

You can retrieve CampaignAttributeId using "GET Campaign Attributes" method.
This method retrieves a dictionary of possible pair values: Managers and their ID's.
This method retrieves a dictionary of possible pair values: Comanagers and their ID's.
This method retrieves a dictionary of possible pair values: Labels and Label ID's.
This method retrieves a dictionary of possible pair values: Advertisers and their ID's.

This method returns a list of all label groups, filtered by specified CampaignId. 

CampaignId parameter is required in your request url. 

EXAMPLE: ?CampaignId=00000

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

FYI: You can use "Params" button for easier parameter management.

This method adds a new label for the specified campaign label group.

LabelId is required in the request body that you are parsing.

EXAMPLE: "Id": 00000

You can retrieve LabelId using "GET Labels" method.

This method returns a list of campaign landing pages. 

CampaignId is required in your request url.

NOTE: You can retrieve a specific landing page by parsing LandingPageId on the request url.

EXAMPLE: api/v1/LandingPages/00000/LandingPage/11111
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - LandingPageId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "Get Campaigns" method.

This method adds a new landing page for a specified campaign. 

CampaignId is required in your request url.

EXAMPLE: api/v1/LandingPages/00000/LandingPage
(00000 - CampaignId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "Get Campaigns" method.

This method updates an existing landing page for a specified campaign.

CampaignId and LandingPageId are required in your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /v1/LandingPages/00000/LandingPage/11111
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - LandingPageId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "Get Campaigns" method.

You can retrieve LandingPageId using "Get Landing Pages" method.

This method deletes an existing landing page for a specified campaign (unless it is default landing page).

NOTE: You need to parse CampaignId and LandingPageId on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /v1/LandingPages/00000/LandingPage/11111
(00000 - CampaignId, 11111 - LandingPageId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "Get Campaigns" method. 
You can retrive LandingPageId using "Get Landing Pages" method.

This method returns a list of all campaigns which are under the same client as you have logged in.

You can filter campaigns by parsing these parametes on the request URL (variable types are specified in brackets):

1. Status (byte; 1 - running, 2 - pending, 3 - finished)
2. AdvertiserId
3. Type (byte; 1 - display, 2 - email, 3 affiliate, 4 - mobile, 5 - social media, 6 - mixed, 7 - non campaign, 8 - Google, 9 - Yahoo, 10 - search/non api, 11 - search/all, 12 - realtimebidding, 13 - Microsoft)
4. DateFrom (dateTime)
5. DateTo (dateTime)
6. State (byte; 1- active, 2 inactive, 3 - deleted)
7. ... (find more on http://api.adform.com/)

EXAMPLES: 
?State=1
?DateFrom=2010-10-22T23:59:00

FYI: You can use "Params" button for easier parameter management.

This method returns a list of campaigns that the user has access to at the agency level. When no filter parameters are specified, list contains of 100 active campaigns.

More information about possible query parameters: 
http://api.adform.com/v1/help/buyer/campaigns#!/Campaigns/Campaigns_GetList

This method returns a list of Advertiser's tracking campaigns.

Advertiser ID parameter is required in your request url. 

EXAMPLE: ?advertiserId=00000

You can retrieve Advertiser ID using "GET Advertisers" method.

FYI: You can use "Params" button for easier parameter management.

This method creates a new advertising campaign.

You can retrieve AdvertiserId using "GET Advertisers" method.

You can retrieve ResponsibleUserId using "GET Users" method.

This method updates an existing advertising campaign which is identified by CampaignId.

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

This method returns a list of enabled features for campaigns which are under the same client as you have logged in.

EXAMPLE: You can retrieve on which agencies alerts are enabled.
This method changes campaign status from active to inactive and the other way round by parsing CampaignId in request body (can be more than 1 CampaignId).

This method returns campaign RTB settings. 

CampaignId is required in your request url.

EXAMPLE: v1/campaigns/00000/rtbsettings
(00000 - CampaignId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "Get Campaigns" method or using Dictionaries.

This method updates campaign RTB settings such as budget and capping. 

CampaignId is required in your request url.

EXAMPLE: v1/campaigns/00000/rtbsettings
(00000 - CampaignId)

You can retrieve CampaignId using "Get Campaigns" method or using Dictionaries.
